Dear ___,

I hope this letter finds you recovering comfortably at home following your recent hospital stay. I am writing to provide you with a summary of your treatment and care received during your admission from March 10, 2024, to March 20, 2024.

You were admitted to the hospital following a fall that resulted in a loss of consciousness. Upon your admission, initial examinations revealed a decreased level of consciousness with a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of 11, along with slurred speech. Due to these concerns, a computed tomography (CT) scan was promptly performed on March 11, 2024, which confirmed the presence of a hemorrhagic stroke in the right hemisphere of your brain. Consequently, you were diagnosed with an intracerebral hemorrhage.

Throughout your hospitalization, comprehensive laboratory tests were conducted. The results from your complete blood count (CBC) indicated slightly low hemoglobin levels and elevated white blood cell (WBC) counts. Additionally, your coagulation profile revealed an elevated International Normalized Ratio (INR), suggesting prolonged bleeding time.

Treatment for your condition included the administration of Mannitol at a dose of 0.25 g/kg every six hours to manage cerebral edema. Furthermore, antihypertensive medications were prescribed as needed based on your blood pressure readings to prevent further complications.

During your stay, you experienced a range of symptoms including persistent slurred speech, right-sided weakness, and some periods of agitation and confusion. Safety measures were implemented to prevent additional falls. It took some time for your condition to stabilize, and continuous monitoring was required.

Please adhere to any follow-up appointments and prescribed medication regimens. Should you experience any changes in your symptoms or if new concerns arise, do not hesitate to reach out to your healthcare provider.

We all wish you a complete and swift recovery. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or require further assistance.
